result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lezan C Jackson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lezan C Jackson in court.  Attorney Robert J Hampton III in court for Lezan C Jackson.  Prosecuting attorney James C Griffin in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Parties have reached a resolution. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.  

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY as to COUNT 1.  

Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen deportation is possible. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived their rights.  Plea questionnaire, addendum and jury instructions received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Defendant is advised is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms.  
Defendant is advised unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored.  

*All conditions of bail remain.

Matter adjourned for sentencing hearing in Branch 02.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 10:30 am.

OFF RECORD - Defendant Lezan C Jackson in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Lezan C Jackson appeared by video means with Attorney. Defense is requesting a plea and sentencing date. Case is adjourned in Branch 02.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Lezan C Jackson in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defense counsel and defendant appear by Zoom. Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 2 via Zoom.  Status conference scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Lezan C Jackson in court with Attorney Robert J Hampton; both appear by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Brown Deer Officer B. Caddock.   Court took judicial notice of 16CF5752.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription and no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Lezan C Jackson in court with attorney Amanda M. Parent.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 2.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Lezan C Jackson
Current: 6416 N 56th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53223   (Effective: 04-18-2022)
Prior: 3012 West Michigan Street, Milwaukee, WI 53208
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 4/18/22 @ 1:30p
